title: Importance of Austerity in Spiritual Life | Sri Amitasana Dasa | ISKCON Bangalore
speaker: HG Amitasana Dasa

segments.text: So many donors, so many problems, so many escalations.
There could be somebody who is interested in his own deliverance, personal deliverance.
A person with that mentality, why should I break my head?
Why should I be involved in this thing?
But if we execute the instructions of Prabhupada,
who desired that preaching be expanded,
more and more people get Krishna consciousness.
Prabhupada very emphatically demonstrated by his personal example
what he desired, what he wanted from his disciples.
Spiritual life means austerity, tapo divyam.
And austerity means voluntarily accepting some inconvenience
There may be inconvenience, but we accept it for a higher cause.
